meanings.sent1: The thunder made a loud rumble in the sky.
meanings.sent2: I heard a distant rumble of a passing train.
meanings.sent3: The rumble of the old car engine sounded like a sleepy bear.
meanings.sent4: The rumble of the waterfall echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The rumble of the earthquake shook the ground beneath our feet.

meanings.definition: To make a continuous deep, resonant sound.
meanings.sent1: The truck engine started to rumble as it idled.
meanings.sent2: The thunder continued to rumble in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The old fridge likes to rumble like a grumpy cat.
meanings.sent4: His stomach began to rumble loudly during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The volcano started to rumble before the eruption.

meanings.sent1: The neighborhood kids got into a loud rumble after school.
meanings.sent2: The rumble between the two gangs caused chaos in the street.
meanings.sent3: The rumble over the last piece of cake was intense but funny.
meanings.sent4: The rumble between the rival soccer teams ended in a draw.
meanings.sent5: The rumble between the siblings over the TV remote was settled peacefully.

meanings.definition: To engage in a street fight or brawl.
meanings.sent1: The two groups started to rumble in the park.
meanings.sent2: The kids decided to rumble instead of talking out their differences.
meanings.sent3: The cats began to rumble over the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The fans started to rumble in the stands during the intense game.
meanings.sent5: The protesters began to rumble against the new law in the city square.
